channel.description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects

item.title: „ÄêCutting JavaScript into two: trick or treat?„ÄëÂ∞Ü JavaScript ‰∏ÄÂàÜ‰∏∫‰∫åÔºö‰∏çÁªôÁ≥ñÂ∞±Êç£ËõãÔºü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã711 ‚Äî October 31, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Python Jumps to #1 on GitHub Over JavaScript, But... ‚Äî GitHub Universe took place this week, flooding us with data about how folks are using the platform. Of interest to those on social media was that Python has taken JavaScript's #1 language crown, though many argued that TypeScript (now #3) made an impact here. In positive news, JS still ranks first for code pushes alone and there's been a 15% jump in npm package consumption in the past¬†year.

GitHub

üéâ In other GitHub news, their Copilot AI coding tool can now use alternative LLMs like Gemini and Claude, and GitHub Spark is a new AI-powered tool for rapidly creating and deploying small apps.

Implementing Clean Architecture in Next.js ‚Äî Learn how to make projects testable and debuggable, independent of UI, framework, database, and external dependencies with the concept of Clean Architecture. Join us live on November¬†4th.

Sentry sponsor

Should JavaScript Be Split Into Two Languages? ‚Äî Two weeks ago we linked to an interesting slidedeck presented at TC39 where it was proposed to split JavaScript into two languages: a basic core and a fully featured version that needs tooling to compile it down. This covers a bit more of the story and led to a particularly extensive Hacker News discussion too.

Dev Class

ü§î You could argue TypeScript is already that second language..?

IN BRIEF:

  • ‚úÇÔ∏è The latest version of VS Code has a new experimental feature for updating imports when you copy and paste between JS/TS¬†files.

  • Lee Robinson and Delba de Oliveira present a quick recap of last week's Next.js Conf 2024 and its main¬†announcements.

  • ü§ñ Anthropic's Claude AI system has introduced an 'analysis' tool for writing and running JavaScript within a sandbox, so Claude can perform various calculations and analysis before returning answers.

  • üôã The Angular team is considering implementing a new Angular style guide to bring it up to 2024 standards and wants your input. The existing style guide was written in¬†2016.

RELEASES:

  • Node.js v22.11.0 (LTS) - Codenamed Jod, this marks Node v22 becoming the active LTS release of Node, a status it will maintain until late¬†2025.

  • Node.js v23.1.0 (Current) ‚Äì The cutting edge Node release line makes JSON modules, import attributes, and the MockTimers test runner API stable.

  • üìä ApexCharts 4.0 ‚Äì Popular JS charting library updates its SVG.js¬†dependency.

  • Chakra UI v3 ‚Äì A full rewrite for the comprehensive React component¬†suite.

  • jQuery UI 1.14.1

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

How We Shrunk Our JavaScript Monorepo Git Size by 94% ‚Äî And by ‚Äúwe‚Äù, the author means Microsoft, which had an extremely large 178 gigabyte JavaScript monorepo on its hands ‚Äì big enough that many employees had problems cloning it at all. Jonathan tells the full story¬†here.

Jonathan Creamer

How to Roll Your Own Auth in JavaScript and TypeScript ‚Äî A snappy look at how to build a session-based authentication system, something Robin notes ‚Äúdoes not have to be¬†complicated‚Äù.

Robin Wieruch

MongoDB Atlas Search Integration with BuildShip ‚Äî MongoDB Atlas Search offers powerful full-text search, vector search, and hybrid search¬†capabilities.

MongoDB sponsor

Using shadcn/ui with React 19 (and Next.js 15) ‚Äî Fresh documentation from the shadcn/ui project on the specifics of using the popular component library with React 19 generally, though with a slight emphasis on Next.js¬†15.

shadcn

Reimplementing JavaScript's == in JavaScript ‚Äî What a trip. Whether or not you‚Äôre aware of the ‚Äòquirks‚Äô of JavaScript‚Äôs == operator, this could boggle your¬†mind.

Evan Hahn

HTML Form Validation is Heavily Underused ‚Äî An exploration of the ‚Äúpowerful validation mechanisms‚Äù of HTML forms, opining that they‚Äôre underused, and proposing why that lack of utilization may¬†be.

everdimension

üìÑ Node.js, Pipes, and Disappearing Bytes ‚Äì If piping a Node app‚Äôs output to another command, mysterious problems can¬†arise.. Sam Lijin

üìÑ Introducing the New Svelte CLI Tool: sv Ben McCann

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Faker 9.1: Generate Fake, Realistic Data on Demand ‚Äî Names, bios, addresses, zip codes, dates, monetary amounts, transactions, and a lot more besides. I really like the guided DevTools console based demo you can try ‚Äì an idea other projects should consider. GitHub¬†repo.

Faker.js Team

Fraction.js: Library for Working with Rational Numbers ‚Äî The imprecise representation of floating point numbers can lead to all sorts of problems, so if you‚Äôre working with fractions at all, you might want a little more precision, which Fraction.js¬†offers.

Robert Eisele

Handsontable: Spreadsheet-Like JavaScript Data Grid for Your App ‚Äî Feature-rich data grid for developers seeking a powerful, customizable, and accessible solution to manage complex¬†data.

Handsontable sponsor

Fedify: A Framework for Building ActivityPub Servers ‚Äî If you want to join the fediverse with an app of your own (rather than leaning on Mastodon, say), this gives you the building blocks you¬†need.

Hong Minhee

Yantra: A JavaScript Engine for .NET Standard ‚Äî A managed JS engine for .NET Standard written in C# that supports both CommonJS and ES¬†modules.

Yantra Team

SVG.js: SVG Manipulation and Animation Library ‚Äî A lightweight approach without dependencies. There‚Äôs a demo on JSFiddle you can play with. GitHub¬†repo.

Various Authors

Dependency Cruiser 16.5: A Way to Visualize Dependencies ‚Äî If you want a look at the output, there‚Äôs a whole page of graphs for popular, real world projects including Chalk, Yarn, and¬†React.

Sander Verweij

AuthKit: The World‚Äôs Best Login Box ‚Äî Powered by WorkOS & Radix ‚Äî AuthKit is a complete solution for authentication, authorization, and user management. It‚Äôs free up to 1 million MAUs and comes standard with RBAC, bot protection, MFA, and¬†more.

AuthKit sponsor

üîä¬†WebAssembly Audio Decoders ‚Äî Targeting both browser and Node.js use cases, this is a collection of WASM-powered audio decoding libraries for formats like MPEG I/II/III, FLAC, Ogg Opus, Ogg FLAC, Opus, and Ogg¬†Vorbis.

Ethan Halsall

  • üì∫ YouTube.js 11.0 ‚Äì Unofficial JS client for YouTube's private¬†API.

  • Serverless Express 4.16 ‚Äì Run Express.js on AWS Lambda, API Gateway, Lambda@Edge, etc. Now supporting Express 5¬†too.

  • Execa 9.5 ‚Äì Powerful process execution library for Node. When redirecting stdout or stderr to a file, you can now optionally append rather than¬†replace.

  • MUI X 7.22 ‚Äì Popular React component¬†suite. Now with server-side support for Data Grid row¬†grouping.

  • üóìÔ∏è react-calendar 5.1 ‚Äì The 'ultimate' calendar for your React app.

  • üì∑ VisionCamera 4.6 ‚Äì Advanced camera control for React¬†Native.

  • Elliptic 6.6 ‚Äì Plain JS elliptic curve cryptography¬†implementation.

  • Acorn 8.14 ‚Äì Small, fast, JavaScript-based JavaScript¬†parser.

  • Strapi 5.2 ‚Äì Popular Node.js headless¬†CMS.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üè† Remote Senior Developer Experience Engineer - Passionate about React & GraphQL? Join us as a Developer Experience Engineer to elevate our dev community. Remote, EU¬†timezone.

How Google handles authorization at scale. A technical comparison of Google's Relationship-based authz system and Oso's Authz as a¬†Service.

item.title: „ÄêJS0 + JSSugar not so sweet?„ÄëJS0 + JSSugar ‰∏çÈÇ£‰πàÁîúÂêóÔºü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã709 ‚Äî October 17, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The Story of Web Framework Hono, By Its Creator ‚Äî Hono is a neat, lightweight framework designed to run on any JavaScript runtime that has been picking up steam in the past year. You can create a simple app reminiscent of Express.js, say, but run it on Cloudflare Workers, Deno, Bun, or Node. It‚Äôs in heavy use all over the place, and has lots of interesting features like letting you write HTML with¬†JSX.

Yusuke Wada

Supercharge Your Node.js Code Reviews with AI ‚Äî Tired of event loop bottlenecks, async errors, and dependency vulnerabilities slipping through code reviews? CodeRabbit, an AI-powered code review tool, analyzes your codebase line-by-line, detecting perf issues, optimizing async patterns, and enhancing security with each pull¬†request.

CodeRabbit sponsor

Node v23.0.0 (Current) Released ‚Äî Say hello to the newest release line of Node.js that gets all the cutting edge features first (Node 22 will soon become an LTS release as per the usual schedule). Node v23 notably enables support for loading ES modules with require() by default, drops 32-bit Windows support, and node --run goes¬†stable.

Rafael Gonzaga

JS0/JSSugar: 'The Tooling Will Continue Until Morale Improves' ‚Äî In a rather quirky slidedeck presented at TC39 recently, an idea was floated to call the language JS engines implement ‚ÄòJS0‚Äô and a myriad of features that have to be compiled to JS0 ‚ÄòJSSugar‚Äô. It might not surprise you that this idea is considered.. controversial and ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Theo Browne did a 25-minute video digging into it¬†further.

Caolan

IN BRIEF:

  • Greensock's popular JavaScript animation library GSAP has been acquired by Webflow ‚Äì it'll continue to be updated and maintained as before.

  • Did you know setTimeout struggles to set timeouts longer than 25 days (or 2^31 milliseconds) in duration? Never fear: Evan Hahn unveils setBigTimeout.

  • quickjs-cross-compiler provides a way to generate static binaries of JavaScript apps for x86_64, i686, ARM 7, and¬†ARM64.

RELEASES:

  • Electron 33 ‚Äì The popular way to build cross-platform desktop apps gets a bump up to Chromium 30, Node 20.18, V8 13, but drops macOS 10.15¬†support.

  • Wasp 0.15 ‚Äì Wasp is a Rails-like framework using Node, React &¬†Prisma.

  • Zustand 5.0 ‚Äì Simple, flux-inspired state management for¬†React.

  • Javet 4.0 ‚Äì Java + V8. Embed Node.js and V8 into¬†Java.

  • Next.js 15 Release Candidate 2, Node.js 22.10.0 (Current), Jasmine 5.4

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

How to Build an Image Search App with CLIP, Postgres & JavaScript ‚Äî A tutorial that brings together a lot of ideas in one place. CLIP is used to turn images into text descriptions. Postgres is used as a vector database. JavaScript provides the glue for both the frontend (with React) and backend (Node.js).

Haziqa Sajid

Using Sibling Parameters as Default Values in Functions ‚Äî function myFunc(arg1, arg2 = arg1)? A technique safely in the ‚Äònot a lot of people know you can do that‚Äô pile. Alex digs into it a bit and looks at some use¬†cases.

Alex MacArthur

[Guide] Debugging Microservices & Distributed Systems ‚Äî Learn best practices on understanding and debugging modern web applications. Read the¬†guide.

Sentry sponsor

Liskov's Gun: The Parallel Evolution of React and Web Components ‚Äî An opinion piece so long there‚Äôs an EPUB version. Baldur tackles Web Components, their growing pains, why frameworks like React took a different path, and why the whole topic remains a difficult circle to¬†square.

Baldur Bjarnason

React Folder Structure in Five Steps, 2024 Edition ‚Äî Articles about structuring React apps are always popular; this one breaks the idea down to five steps from the simplest of apps to more complex ones. Bulletproof React is worth a look too for something¬†broader.

Robin Wieruch

Optimize Your Builds with Depot‚Äôs GitHub Actions Price Calculator ‚Äî Depot just launched a GitHub Actions price calculator. Get a cost breakdown and make your builds faster and¬†cheaper!

Depot / GitHub Actions Price Calculator sponsor

üìÑ ü´£ Implementing Regular Expressions in TypeScript Types (Badly) ‚Äì It‚Äôs almost Halloween so scary stories are¬†welcome. Steven Kalt

üìÑ 'I Interviewed 100 DevTools Founders and This Is What I Learned' Jack Bridger

üìÑ Handling In-Browser Paste Events in JavaScript Raymond Camden

üìÑ The Nuances of Base64 Encoding Strings in JavaScript Matt Joseph

üìÑ How to Convert CommonJS to ESM Andy Jiang

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

ApexCharts: Flexible Interactive Charting Library ‚Äî A mature and frequently updated charting library for creating interactive data visualizations, with sparklines, heatmaps, line charts, funnel charts, pies, and others. Can be used in a vanilla way or alongside Angular, Vue or React and there are lots of live examples (with code for each). GitHub¬†repo.

ApexCharts

Over 100 Algorithms and Data Structures Demonstrated in JS ‚Äî Examples of numerous common algorithms (e.g. bit manipulation, Pascal‚Äôs triangle, Hamming distance) and data structures (e.g. linked lists, tries, graphs) with¬†explanations.

Oleksii Trekhleb et al.

Developer Kit: Learn How to Troubleshoot Front-End Issues Faster ‚Äî Get the kit curated to help front-end developers better understand user activity and resolve issues more¬†efficiently.

Datadog sponsor

fast-grid: The World's Most Performant DOM-Based Web Table? ‚Äî A bold claim, but you can see for yourself using the online demo, which lets you filter, sort, and scroll simultaneously for a true¬†test.

Gabriel Petersson

üé®¬†Color Thief: Grab Color Palettes from Images ‚Äî Given an image, this uses canvas to return a list of the dominant colors. Works in browsers or¬†Node.

Lokesh Dhakar

Node Version Manager Desktop 4.0 ‚Äî A Tauri-powered desktop app for macOS, Windows and Linux to manage multiple installed versions of Node on your¬†system.

rainbow

üéπ¬†ChordSymbol: Chord Symbol Parser and Renderer ‚Äî Accepts chord names in strings (e.g. G7/B, Cadd9, Asus2) and lets you access the notes those chords are made of. GitHub¬†repo.

Christophe No√´l

  • debounce 2.2 ‚Äì Delay function calls until a set time elapses after the last¬†invocation.

  • üò≥ NSFW.js 4.2 ‚Äì Client-side NSFW image detection via¬†TensorFlow.js.

  • Secretlint 9.0 ‚Äì Tool to prevent committing¬†credentials/secrets.

  • ‚òéÔ∏é vue-tel-input 9.2 ‚Äì Telephone number input for Vue.¬†(Demo.)

  • üóìÔ∏è Qalendar 3.9 ‚Äì Event calendar and date picker for Vue 3.

  • Vaul 1.1 ‚Äì Unstyled drawer React¬†component.¬†(Demo.)

  • Mineflayer 4.22 ‚Äì Create Minecraft bots in¬†JavaScript.

  • FxTS 1.1 ‚Äì Functional programming library for¬†TS/JS.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üéπ STRICH: Add blazing fast and reliable 1D/2D Barcode Scanning to your web apps. Free demo app and 30-day trial¬†available.

ü™ù Hookdeck: A serverless queue to reliably send, receive, transform, filter, and route events across your event-driven¬†apps.

item.title: „ÄêA huge week for ECMAScript proposals„ÄëECMAScript ÊèêÊ°àÁöÑÈáçË¶Å‰∏ÄÂë®
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã708 ‚Äî October 10, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

TC39 Advances 10+ ECMAScript Proposals ‚Äî The architects behind the development of the ECMAScript / JavaScript spec got together again this week (you can see them in this tweet) and they had a packed agenda. Import attributes, Iterator helpers, Promise.try and Regexp modifiers all made it to stage 4, and more¬†besides.

Sarah Gooding (Socket)

ü¶ñ¬†Announcing Deno 2 ‚Äî A huge release for the ‚Äúwhat if I reinvented Node again from scratch?‚Äù runtime. Backwards compatibility with Node is a headline feature, but there‚Äôs a lot more baked in. Best, though, is the ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†epic ‚ÄòAnnouncing Deno 2‚Äô video. After a slightly bombastic opener, Ryan presents a fantastic ‚Äòkeynote‚Äô style tour of everything Deno has to offer ‚Äì I enjoyed watching¬†it.

Dahl, Belder, Iwa≈Ñczuk and Jiang

üí° A neat new feature is Deno's Jupyter Notebook support which Simon Willison checks out¬†here.

A Deeper Understanding of Web Security ‚Äî Steve Kinney hosts this extensive video course on the challenges of web security. You'll gain a deeper understanding of security on the web, developing your mental model on how to approach things, explore common vulnerabilities, get hands-on experience with security tools, and get to grips with best¬†practices.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Announcing TypeScript 5.7 Beta ‚Äî The newest TypeScript is on the way. As always, a true laundry list of enhancements and new features, but the path rewriting for relative paths is a particularly welcome addition, enabling easy rewrites of .ts imports into .js at compile¬†time.

Microsoft

IN BRIEF:

  • Ian Grunert writes about work done to (re)enable JavaScriptCore's JIT mechanisms on Windows. This is particularly good news for Bun users.

  • Did you know MySQL 9.0 now natively supports JavaScript stored routines?

  • üá∫üá∏ The next JSNation event is taking place in a hybrid form both remotely and in New York City this November 18 and¬†21. Some fantastic speakers¬†await.

  • Tenno is an interesting online Markdown editor that supports adding spreadsheet-like cells that can be populated by¬†JavaScript.

  • üïπÔ∏è The winners of the latest js13kGames game jam have been announced. It's amazing what people have managed to achieve in just¬†13KB.

RELEASES:

  • Bun v1.1.30 ‚Äì Now includes experimental CSS parsing and bundling, as well as a bun publish to publish npm packages, a la npm publish. You can also compile code to bytecode to speed up startup¬†times.

  • Node.js v20.18.0 (LTS) ‚Äì Now with network inspection support.

  • React Native Storybook 8.3 ‚Äì React Native support in the popular component workshop finally gets fully up to¬†speed.

  • Rsdoctor 0.4 ‚Äì Tool for analyzing the Rspack / Webpack build¬†process.

  • ESLint 9.12.0, Electron.js 32.2, Ember 5.12

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

Building a Local Single-Page App with htmx ‚Äî If you have a reasonably simple app to build, using a large framework is probably going to be overkill. htmx to the rescue! Jake presents an easily followed practical tutorial packed with¬†code.

Jake Lazaroff

üí° Jake also wrote an interesting case study of building a local-first app using SvelteKit and Shoelace, if you want to see something more¬†fully-formed.

Product for Engineers: A Newsletter Helping Flex Your Product Muscle ‚Äî Product for Engineers is dedicated to sharing the skills and strategies product engineers need to¬†succeed.

PostHog sponsor

Build a Static RSS Reader To Fight Your Inner FOMO ‚Äî The theme of lightweight JavaScript apps continues with a look at creating a basic RSS feed reader, that updates once a day, with¬†Astro.

Karin Hendrikse

Node vs Bun: No Backend Performance Difference? ‚Äî You can always trust a benchmark to ruffle some feathers, often over the methodology rather than the result. This is no exception, but interesting¬†nonetheless.

Evert Heylen

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Building a Tic-Tac-Toe Game in TypeScript Types ‚Äî One of those videos I enjoyed simply so I don‚Äôt ever feel tempted to try it¬†myself.

Typed Rocks

Securing Node.js Express APIs with Clerk and React ‚Äî Secure Express API endpoints and integrate authentication without the complexity of building it from¬†scratch.

Clerk sponsor

üìÑ Building a Robust Frontend using Progressive Enhancement UK Government

üìÑ The Popover API: Your New Best Friend for Tooltips ‚Äì Supported in all major browsers, except Safari on iOS. Sjoerd Beentjes

üìÑ 18 Interview Questions Answered by Angular Experts Angular Space

üìÑ Testing CSS Print Media Styles with Cypress Gleb Bahmutov

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

DOCX 9.0: Generate Word .docx Files from JavaScript ‚Äî The code to lay out documents is verbose but there‚Äôs a lot of functionality baked in and there aren‚Äôt many other options for this task. Here‚Äôs a CodePen-based example to give you an idea. GitHub¬†repo.

Dolan Miu

TinyJS: A Lightweight Way to Work with DOM Elements ‚Äî Lighter than querySelector and friends, you ask? Not in file size, but certainly in code weight. TinyJS offers a jQuery-esque syntax for element selection, adding properties to elements, and¬†more.

Victor Ribeiro

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future ‚Äî 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, supports Vitest, jest, karma, jasmine, and¬†more.

Wallaby Team sponsor

SVGuitar 2.4: Create SVG-Based Guitar Chord Charts ‚Äî Dynamically generate chord charts / fingerings in the browser. You can experiment with it in this live¬†demo.

Raphael Voellmy

Free Public APIs: A Collection of Free Public APIs for Developers ‚Äî Categorized and searchable, these are tested daily by bots so if any API is taken down or moved behind a paywall, it's removed from the¬†site.

Nick Schneeberger

TutorialKit 1.0: Create Interactive Coding Tutorials ‚Äî StackBlitz‚Äôs framework for creating interactive coding tutorials, perhaps as a way to boost the adoption of your own libraries or design system. v1.0 marks TutorialKit as¬†stable.

StackBlitz

Jeasx: The Ease of JSX with the Power of SSR ‚Äî A new server side rendering framework built on top of JSX and¬†Fastify.

Maik Jablonski

ip-address 10.0: Library for Parsing and Manipulating IP Addresses ‚Äî Works with both IPv4 and IPv6¬†addresses.

Beau Gunderson

  • React-Grid-Layout 1.5 ‚Äì Draggable/resizable grid layouts for React¬†apps.

  • üóìÔ∏è Schedule-X 2.4 ‚Äì Material Design event calendar and date¬†picker.

  • eslint-plugin-unicorn 56.0 ‚Äì 100+ useful ESLint rules in one¬†place.

  • Redwood 8.4 ‚Äì Popular React app¬†framework.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Automatically creates & maintains E2E UI tests. Zero flakes. Used by Lattice, Bilt Rewards and others. Backed by YC, CTO GitHub and¬†others.

Pythagora is an AI dev tool that builds production-ready tools (not demo apps). It writes the code and talks to you in the¬†process.

‚öôÔ∏è Create entire web apps with Reactile and let it handle your widgets and windows within a single browser tab. 1-month free trial. Try it¬†now.
